allergens.description: Proteins that can trigger immune system responses in sensitive individuals

hazards.name: Buckwheat
hazards.description: An emerging allergen in gluten-free products, unrelated to wheat despite its name.

hazards.name: Pea Protein
hazards.description: Increasingly used in plant-based foods; may cross-react with peanut allergies.

hazards.name: Mustard Oil
hazards.description: Distinct from mustard seeds; common in South Asian cuisine and topical use.

hazards.name: Corn (Maize)
hazards.description: Often overlooked but can trigger IgE-mediated reactions.

hazards.name: Kiwi
hazards.description: Common allergenic fruit with cross-reactivity to latex and birch pollen.

hazards.name: Lentils
hazards.description: Frequent allergen in Mediterranean/Middle Eastern diets.

compositional_issues.description: Problems related to the fundamental composition of food products

hazards.name: Nutrient imbalances
hazards.description: Disproportionate levels of nutrients

hazards.name: Improper formulation
hazards.description: Incorrect ingredient ratios or formulations
sources: Infant formula with improper nutrient balance

hazards.name: Missing essential ingredients
hazards.description: Absence of required components
sources: Specialty medical foods lacking required elements

hazards.name: Excessive moisture content
hazards.description: Water content above acceptable levels
sources: Dried foods with excess moisture leading to spoilage
Meat products with water added beyond regulatory limits

hazards.name: Incorrect fat composition
hazards.description: Fat content or composition that differs from specifications
sources: Dairy products with fat content below labeled claims
Oils with incorrect fatty acid profiles

hazards.name: Incorrect vitamin/mineral fortification
hazards.description: Over- or under-fortification of vitamins/minerals beyond declared levels

hazards.name: Undisclosed preservative levels
hazards.description: Preservatives (e.g., sulfites, nitrates) exceeding regulatory limits or undeclared

hazards.name: Protein adulteration
hazards.description: Dilution of protein content with non-protein fillers (e.g., melamine, nitrogen-rich compounds)

hazards.name: Incorrect fatty acid profile
hazards.description: Deviation from declared omega-3/omega-6 ratios or trans-fat levels

hazards.name: Fiber content misrepresentation
hazards.description: Inaccurate soluble/insoluble fiber ratios or overstated total fiber content

environmental_contaminants.description: Harmful substances from environmental sources that enter the food chain

hazards.name: Heavy metals
hazards.description: Toxic metals that can accumulate in the body

hazards.name: Persistent organic pollutants (POPs)
hazards.description: Chemical substances that persist in the environment and bioaccumulate

hazards.name: Persistent organic pollutants (POPs) - Per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS)
Radioactive contaminants
hazards.description: Radionuclides that can contaminate food sources

hazards.name: Microplastics
hazards.description: Plastic particles <5mm from environmental degradation, found in aquatic food chains

hazards.name: Perchlorate
hazards.description: Industrial chemical contaminating water/soil, disrupts thyroid function

hazards.name: Dioxin-like PCBs
hazards.description: PCB congeners that mimic dioxin toxicity, persistent in animal fats

hazards.name: Chromium (Hexavalent)
hazards.description: Industrial carcinogen contaminating water and soil

hazards.name: Pesticide transformation products
hazards.description: Toxic breakdown products of pesticides (e.g., DDT→DDE)

hazards.name: Nanoparticles (engineered)
hazards.description: Manufactured nanoparticles from industrial use entering food chain

feed_additives.description: Substances intentionally added to food or animal feed for technological or sensory purposes

hazards.name: Preservatives
hazards.description: Substances that prevent or inhibit spoilage

hazards.name: Food colorings
hazards.description: Substances that add or restore color

hazards.name: Flavor enhancers
hazards.description: Substances that enhance existing flavors

hazards.name: Sweeteners
hazards.description: Natural and artificial substances that provide sweetness

contact_materials.description: Materials that come into contact with food during production, packaging, or storage

hazards.name: Packaging migrants
hazards.description: Chemicals that can transfer from packaging into food

hazards.name: Packaging migrants - Phthalates
sources: Food processing equipment with PVC parts

hazards.name: Packaging migrants - Semicarbazide
sources: Plastic gaskets in metal lids of glass jars

hazards.name: Processing equipment materials
hazards.description: Substances from equipment used in food production

hazards.name: Processing equipment materials - Mineral oil hydrocarbons
Printing inks
hazards.description: Inks used on food packaging materials

hazards.name: Adhesives
hazards.description: Substances used to seal or construct packaging

fraud.description: Deliberate substitution, addition, tampering, or misrepresentation of food for economic gain

hazards.name: Adulteration
hazards.description: Adding inferior or foreign substances to food

hazards.name: Adulteration - Melamine in milk products
hazards.description: Addition to artificially increase apparent protein content

hazards.name: Adulteration - Sudan dyes in spices
hazards.description: Addition of industrial dyes to enhance color

hazards.name: Adulteration - Dilution of olive oil with cheaper oils
hazards.description: Mixing premium olive oil with lower quality oils

hazards.name: Substitution
hazards.description: Replacing an ingredient with a similar, cheaper alternative

hazards.name: Substitution - Species substitution in seafood
hazards.description: Selling lower-value fish species as premium varieties

hazards.name: Substitution - Honey adulteration
hazards.description: Diluting honey with sugar syrups or other sweeteners

hazards.name: Mislabeling
hazards.description: False or misleading product information

hazards.name: Mislabeling - False country of origin
hazards.description: Claiming products are from regions known for quality

hazards.name: Mislabeling - Falsely labeled organic products
hazards.description: Conventional products sold as organic

hazards.name: Counterfeit products
hazards.description: Fake products made to resemble established brands

hazards.name: Honey adulteration with corn syrup
hazards.description: Dilution of pure honey with cheaper sweeteners like high-fructose corn syrup

hazards.name: Extra virgin olive oil dilution
hazards.description: Mixing premium EVOO with lower-grade olive oils or seed oils

hazards.name: Organic food fraud
hazards.description: Conventional products sold as organic without certification

hazards.name: Seafood species substitution
hazards.description: Mislabeling cheaper fish as premium species (e.g., tilapia as red snapper)

hazards.name: Spice adulteration with fillers
hazards.description: Adding bulking agents like sawdust, starch or dyes to spices

hazards.name: Milk protein adulteration
hazards.description: Adding nitrogen-rich compounds to fake protein content

genetically_modified_material.description: Food derived from organisms whose genetic material has been modified using genetic engineering techniques

hazards.name: Genetically modified crops
hazards.description: Plants with modified genetic material

hazards.name: Genetically modified animals
hazards.description: Animals with modified genetic material

hazards.name: Genetically modified microorganisms
hazards.description: Modified bacteria or fungi used in food production

hazards.name: Unauthorized GM material
hazards.description: Presence of unapproved GM elements in food

irradiation.description: Treatment of food with ionizing radiation to eliminate microorganisms, insects, and parasites

hazards.name: Gamma irradiation
hazards.description: Treatment using gamma rays from radioactive sources

hazards.name: Electron beam irradiation
hazards.description: Treatment using accelerated electrons

hazards.name: X-ray irradiation
hazards.description: Treatment using X-rays generated by machine sources

microbiological_contaminants.description: Harmful microorganisms that can contaminate food and cause foodborne illness

hazards.name: Bacteria - Bacillus cereus
sources: Left at room temperature after cooking

natural_toxicants.description: Naturally occurring substances in foods that can be toxic to humans

hazards.name: Plant toxins - Pyrrolizidine alkaloids
sources: Honey from plants containing these alkaloids

hazards.name: Marine biotoxins - Ciguatoxin
sources: Large reef fish such as barracuda, grouper, snapper

hazards.name: Marine biotoxins - Domoic acid (Amnesic shellfish toxin)
Marine biotoxins - Scombrotoxin (histamine)
sources: Dark meat fish like tuna, mackerel, bonito

novel_foods.description: Foods without a significant history of consumption or produced by new production processes

hazards.name: Novel protein sources
hazards.description: Non-traditional sources of protein

hazards.name: Novel protein sources - Cultured meat
hazards.description: Lab-grown meat from animal cells

hazards.name: Novel protein sources - Single-cell proteins
hazards.description: Proteins derived from microorganisms

hazards.name: Novel ingredients
hazards.description: Newly discovered or newly used food components

hazards.name: Nanomaterials in food
hazards.description: Engineered particles at nanoscale used in food applications

other_contaminants.description: Contaminants that don't fit in other specific categories

hazards.name: Cleaning and sanitizing agents
hazards.description: Residues from food processing equipment cleaning

hazards.name: Lubricants
hazards.description: Substances used in food processing machinery

hazards.name: Airborne contaminants
hazards.description: Substances from the production environment

hazards.name: Combustion byproducts
hazards.description: Compounds formed during combustion processes near food
sources: Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons from nearby sources

other_issues.description: Concerns that don't fit into the other specified hazard categories

hazards.name: Labeling issues
hazards.description: Problems with product labeling

hazards.name: Foreign language labeling
hazards.description: Product information not in required language

hazards.name: Storage and handling instructions
hazards.description: Improper or missing instructions

hazards.name: Shelf-life concerns
hazards.description: Inaccurate product durability information

hazards.name: Packaging integrity
hazards.description: Compromised packaging that may affect product safety

parasitic_contamination.description: Contamination of food with parasitic organisms

hazards.name: Helminths (worms) - Anisakis
sources: Raw or undercooked fish and seafood

pesticide_residues.description: Remains of pesticides in or on food after application to crops

hazards.name: Insecticides
hazards.description: Chemicals used to control insect pests

hazards.name: Herbicides
hazards.description: Chemicals used to control weeds

hazards.name: Herbicides - Glyphosate
sources: Residues in grains, legumes, and other crops

hazards.name: Fungicides
hazards.description: Chemicals used to control fungal diseases in crops

hazards.name: Multiple residues
hazards.description: Presence of more than one pesticide residue

hazards.name: Unauthorized pesticides
hazards.description: Pesticide residues from compounds not approved for use

processing_contaminants.description: Substances formed during food processing, cooking, or storage

hazards.name: Acrylamide
hazards.description: Forms during high-temperature cooking of carbohydrate-rich foods

hazards.name: Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs)
hazards.description: Form during combustion processes and high-temperature cooking

hazards.name: Heterocyclic amines (HCAs)
hazards.description: Form during high-temperature cooking of protein-rich foods

hazards.name: Furan
hazards.description: Forms during heat treatment processes

hazards.name: 3-MCPD and glycidyl esters
hazards.description: Form during oil refining processes

hazards.name: Trans fatty acids
hazards.description: Form during partial hydrogenation of oils

processing_issues.description: Problems that occur during food production, processing, or preparation

hazards.name: Inadequate processing
hazards.description: Insufficient treatment to ensure food safety

hazards.name: Process deviations
hazards.description: Failures to follow established processing parameters

hazards.name: Cross-contamination
hazards.description: Transfer of hazards from one food or surface to another

hazards.name: Equipment malfunctions
hazards.description: Failures in processing equipment that affect food safety

undesirable_substances_in_animal_feed.description: Contaminants in animal feed that may affect the safety of food derived from animals

hazards.name: Mycotoxins in feed
hazards.description: Toxins produced by fungi in feed materials

hazards.name: Persistent organic pollutants
hazards.description: Environmental contaminants that persist and bioaccumulate

hazards.name: Prohibited animal proteins
hazards.description: Animal proteins banned in certain animal feeds
sources: Ruminant proteins in ruminant feed (BSE prevention)

veterinary_drug_residues.description: Residues of drugs used in food-producing animals

hazards.name: Antibiotics - Chloramphenicol
hazards.description: Broad-spectrum antibiotic banned in food-producing animals in many countries

hazards.name: Antibiotics - Nitrofurans
hazards.description: Synthetic antibacterials banned in food-producing animals in many countries

animal_feed_additives.description: Substances intentionally added to animal feed for various purposes

hazards.name: Nutritional additives
hazards.description: Substances providing nutrients

hazards.name: Zootechnical additives
hazards.description: Substances affecting animal performance or environmental impact

hazards.name: Sensory additives
hazards.description: Substances that improve feed palatability

hazards.name: Technological additives
hazards.description: Substances used for technological purposes

hazards.name: Unauthorized additives
hazards.description: Substances not approved for use in feed
